meanings.definition: To crush or squeeze something with force.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy squishing playdough in my hands.
meanings.sent2: The chef was squishing garlic cloves to add flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was squishing the soft toy in delight.
meanings.sent4: The wrestler was squishing his opponent with immense strength.
meanings.sent5: The mud squishing under my feet felt oddly satisfying.

meanings.definition: The act of making a squishing sound.
meanings.sent1: The squishing of the wet sponge echoed in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: I heard the squishing of the mud as I walked through the swamp.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's squishing noises always make me laugh.
meanings.sent4: The squishing of the grapes signaled the start of winemaking.
meanings.sent5: The squishing of the rubber duck in the bath was oddly soothing.

meanings.definition: The feeling of something being squished or compressed.
meanings.sent1: The squishing of the pillow made it more comfortable to sleep on.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the squishing of the sand between my toes at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The squishing of the stress ball helped relieve tension.
meanings.sent4: The squishing of the marshmallows in the s'mores was messy but delicious.
meanings.sent5: The squishing of the grapes in my hand released a sweet aroma.
